io.github.divayprakash.isprime

Class MainActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.divayprakash.isprime.MainActivity

  • public class MainActivity
extends java.lang.Object
    The MainActivity class implements all the control logic for the 'Prime or Not' Android application.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Divay Prakash

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean IS_PRIME
      Boolean variable representing if the currently displayed number is prime or not.
      private TextView numberDisplay
      TextView variable representing the object to display the random number in.
      private int RANDOM_NUMBER
      int variable representing the random number currently being shown in the app.
      private Vibrator vibratorInstance
      Vibrator instance variable to enable vibration of device when needed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private boolean isPrime()
      This method checks if the RANDOM_NUMBER is prime or not and returns a Boolean value.
      protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
      This method is called at the startup of the application.
      void onExit(View view)
      This is the onClick action handler for the "Exit" FAB button.
      void onFalse(View view)
      This is the onClick action handler for the "False" button.
      void onNext(View view)
      This is the onClick action handler for the "Next" button.
      void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle savedInstanceState)
      This method is called during application destruction and is used to store the instance state so as to be able to restore it at the next initialization.
      void onTrue(View view)
      This is the onClick action handler for the "True" button.
      private int returnRandom()
      This method returns a Random integer in the range 2 to 1000 using ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextInt().

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • RANDOM_NUMBER

        private int RANDOM_NUMBER
        int variable representing the random number currently being shown in the app.

      • IS_PRIME

        private boolean IS_PRIME
        Boolean variable representing if the currently displayed number is prime or not.

      • numberDisplay

        private TextView numberDisplay
        TextView variable representing the object to display the random number in.

      • vibratorInstance

        private Vibrator vibratorInstance
        Vibrator instance variable to enable vibration of device when needed.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        This method is called at the startup of the application. It initializes the random number using parameter savedInstanceState and also assigns the Android VIBRATOR_SERVICE to the Vibrator instance variable using getSystemService().
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The saved instance state of the application.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        This method is called during application destruction and is used to store the instance state so as to be able to restore it at the next initialization.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The saved instance state of the application.

      • onNext

        public void onNext(View view)
        This is the onClick action handler for the "Next" button. It calls the returnRandom() method to assign a new random value to the RANDOM_NUMBER variable. Thereafter, it calls the isPrime() method to determine if RANDOM_NUMBER is prime or not. It then sets the numberDisplay TextView.
        Parameters:
        view - The View instance passed to this method.

      • onTrue

        public void onTrue(View view)
        This is the onClick action handler for the "True" button. It checks the IS_PRIME variable to determine if the answer given is correct or not. Accordingly, it sets the numberDisplay TextView color using TextView.setTextColor() method. It also displays a Toast with a correct/incorrect message. In case of incorrect answer, it uses Vibrator.vibrate() method to vibrate device for 500ms.
        Parameters:
        view - The View instance passed to this method.

      • onFalse

        public void onFalse(View view)
        This is the onClick action handler for the "False" button. It checks the IS_PRIME variable to determine if the answer given is correct or not. Accordingly, it sets the numberDisplay TextView color using TextView.setTextColor() method. It also displays a Toast with a correct/incorrect message. In case of incorrect answer, it uses Vibrator.vibrate() method to vibrate device for 500ms.
        Parameters:
        view - The View instance passed to this method.

      • onExit

        public void onExit(View view)
        This is the onClick action handler for the "Exit" FAB button. It calls the Android finish() method to safely end application execution and thereafter calls System.exit() to clean up variables etc.
        Parameters:
        view - The View instance passed to this method.

      • isPrime

        private boolean isPrime()
        This method checks if the RANDOM_NUMBER is prime or not and returns a Boolean value.
        Returns:
        Boolean value

      • returnRandom

        private int returnRandom()
        This method returns a Random integer in the range 2 to 1000 using ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextInt().
        Returns:
        int value
